title: 107_s888
content: College Tuition Assistance Act of 2001 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow an income-based deduction for qualifying higher education tuition and related expenses on behalf of an individual who can be claimed as a personal exemption by a taxpayer. Increases the: (1) lifetime learning credit to 28 percent of qualified education expenses. And (2) related income eligibility levels. Eliminates specified needs-based educational assistance under the Higher Education Act of 1965 from financial eligibility computations for such credit and the hope scholarship credit. Amends education loan interest provisions to: (1) eliminate the 60-month deductibility limit, (2) increase joint filer income eligibility levels. And (3) apply deductibility limits on a per student basis. Amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to increase Federal Pell grant amounts for academic years 2001-2002 and 2002-2003.
